授業目的: Students will learn various knowledge relating to economics, management, sociology, governance, and cultural studies. They are expected to acquire basics of international studies for conducting following courses in the graduate program.
到達目標:
(1) Students will learn diverse topics and viewpoints and sharpen their insights in order to construct their own research questions.
(2) Students will understand studies conducted by our faculty members in each study field, and prepare for their thesis.

第1回:
Holger Bungsche: Introduction to the Course
Issues of Labour and Industrial Sociology
All classes are face to face
第2回:
Miharu Yui:Interdisciplinary analysis of the South Asian Area Studies
Students will learn the result and prospects in South Asian Area Studies.
第3回:
Miharu Yui:Economic Growth and Extreme Nationalism in Developing India
Students will discuss the issues the issues on religion and politics, poverty and violence, coexistence of different communities in developing India.
第4回: Timothy Yun Hui Tsu: In my sessions, I will discuss issues pertaining to the relation between religion and liberal society in the contemporary world.
第5回: Timothy Yun Hui Tsu: Students will gain insights into the theoretical and practical problems arising from the existence of religion in liberal society in contemporary times.
第6回:
Hiroyuki Atsumi:　International politics and economy from perspectives of innovation
Students will be expected to learn where/how innovations affect international politics and economy.
第7回:
Hiroyuki Atsumi: Japan's issues and potentials in conjunction with globalization
Students will be expected to learn where Japan stands now or will stand in terms of growing globalization.
第8回:
Koji Kojima: Accounting and finance research in the US Part1.
Students will learn basic research areas of accounting and finance in the US and Japan.
第9回:
Koji Kojima: Accounting and finance research in the US Part2.
Students will continue to learn basic research areas of accounting and finance in the US and Japan.
第10回:
Kozo Kunimune: International economy in the globalized world
Students will look back at development of international economy and consider contemporary challenges such as economic growth, income inequality, trade frictions, and globalization.
第11回:
Kozo Kunimune: East Asia’s economic development
Students will look into dynamics of East Asia’s development process, using the knowledge of international economics and focusing Asian currency crisis in 1997.
第12回:
Mineo Takamura: Introduction to Film Analysis
Students will learn how to critical analyze films.
第13回:
Mineo Takamura: Introduction to Literary Analysis
Students will learn how to read and analyze literary texts through a story. It is expected that students will read the material before coming to the class.
第14回:
Holger Bungsche: Issues of Industry Studies
Concluding session
トピック.授業外学習2: 2-3 hours of preparation for each session. Materials will be provided via LUNA
